verses.roman:
tatrābhiṣicya śucaya
upoṣya su-samāhitāḥ
devatāḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ
snapanālepanārhaṇaiḥ

synonyms: tatra—there; abhiṣicya—taking bath; śucayaḥ—cleansed; upoṣya—fasting; su-samāhitāḥ—fixing our minds; devatāḥ—the demigods; pūjayiṣyāmaḥ—we shall worship; snapana—by bathing; ālepana—smearing with sandalwood; arhaṇaiḥ—and by various offerings.
translation: There we should bathe for purification, fast, and fix our minds in meditation. We should then worship the demigods by bathing their images, anointing them with sandalwood pulp, and presenting them various offerings.
